alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 1:15PM CDT until May 02 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo affecting Cass County. .Red River basin river flooding to continue. Recent snowmelt has resulted in a rise above Major flood stage early this week, with a slower gradual recession later this week of the Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo. The river is expected to crest by midweek. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY, MAY 02... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo. * WHEN...Until Tuesday, May 02. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, MAJOR FLOOD. Approximate stage where flooding begins in areas along the Sheyenne River north of the diversion channel to Harwood, ND. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM CDT Monday the stage was 21.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 PM CDT Monday was 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
